meanings.definition: A range of frequencies within a signal that are allowed to pass through a filter.
meanings.sent1: The bandpass of the radio receiver was set to pick up only the music station.
meanings.sent2: The technician adjusted the bandpass to focus on the desired frequency range.
meanings.sent3: I tried to listen to the news on my old radio, but the bandpass seemed to only catch static!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a bandpass, filtering out distractions and focusing on the task at hand.
meanings.sent5: The bandpass of the amplifier highlighted the bass notes, making the music richer.

meanings.definition: To filter a signal to only allow a specific range of frequencies to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The engineer needed to bandpass the audio signal for better clarity.
meanings.sent2: She used the software to bandpass the noise from the recording.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to bandpass out the sound of the vacuum cleaner with a loud purr.
meanings.sent4: His focus bandpassed out all distractions, allowing him to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The bandpassing of the internet connection improved the streaming quality significantly.
